trans-unit.source: Provides information about an unhandled exception that occurred in a workflow instance.
If an exception is thrown by an activity and is unhandled, the default behavior is to terminate the workflow instance.
If an <xref:System.Activities.WorkflowApplication.OnUnhandledException%2A> handler is present, it can override this default behavior.
This handler gives the workflow host author an opportunity to provide the appropriate handling, such as custom logging, aborting the workflow, canceling the workflow, or terminating the workflow.
Gets the activity that is the source of the unhandled exception.
If an exception is thrown by an activity and is unhandled, the default behavior is to terminate the workflow instance.
If an <xref:System.Activities.WorkflowApplication.OnUnhandledException%2A> handler is present, it can override this default behavior.
This handler gives the workflow host author an opportunity to provide the appropriate handling, such as custom logging, aborting the workflow, canceling the workflow, or terminating the workflow.
Gets the unique identifier of the activity instance that is the source of the unhandled exception.
If an exception is thrown by an activity and is unhandled, the default behavior is to terminate the workflow instance.
If an <xref:System.Activities.WorkflowApplication.OnUnhandledException%2A> handler is present, it can override this default behavior.
This handler gives the workflow host author an opportunity to provide the appropriate handling, such as custom logging, aborting the workflow, canceling the workflow, or terminating the workflow.
An identifier of the activity instance that is the source of the unhandled exception.
Gets the <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that was unhandled by the workflow instance.
If an exception is thrown by an activity and is unhandled, the default behavior is to terminate the workflow instance.
If an <xref:System.Activities.WorkflowApplication.OnUnhandledException%2A> handler is present, it can override this default behavior.
This handler gives the workflow host author an opportunity to provide the appropriate handling, such as custom logging, aborting the workflow, canceling the workflow, or terminating the workflow.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that was unhandled by the workflow instance.
